title: High Dependency on Transport Services
description: In 2023, transport services accounted for 76.91% of Mozambique's service exports, indicating a significant reliance on this sector for economic activity.

title: Extremely High External Debt
description: Mozambique's external debt reached 349.68% of its Gross National Income in 2023, highlighting a critical financial vulnerability.

title: High Compensation of Employees
description: In 2022, 62.02% of Mozambique's government expenses were allocated to employee compensation, reflecting a significant portion of budgetary spending.

title: Lengthy Customs Clearance for Exports
description: As of 2018, it took an average of 39.3 days to clear exports through customs in Mozambique, indicating inefficiencies in trade logistics.

title: High Primary Education Enrollment for Males
description: In 2018, the gross intake ratio for males in the first grade of primary education was 173.88%, suggesting over-enrollment or repeat rates.

title: Low Income for Bottom 40% of Population
description: In 2019, the bottom 40% of Mozambique's population had a mean consumption of $0.74 per day, indicating significant poverty levels.

title: Low Overall Income Levels
description: The average daily income per capita in Mozambique was $2.3 in 2019, reflecting widespread economic challenges.

title: Low Proportion of Older Male Population
description: In 2023, only 1.00% of Mozambique's male population was aged 60-64, suggesting a younger demographic profile.

title: Moderate Voice and Accountability
description: With 14 sources contributing to the Voice and Accountability index in 2023, Mozambique shows moderate levels of civic engagement and freedom of expression.
